coredata.ce:para: Furthermore, the fact that a signal is useful for a decoding task does not necessarily mean that it is of interest to the study. For instance, in our example EEG study, eye artefacts can be a predictor for FAS (Quax et al., 2019), see electronic supplementary information, and, despite the preprocessing steps to attenuate them, are likely still present in the pattern matrices (e.g., Fig. 6, participant 22). Furthermore, given that most models in neuroimaging are overfitting due to the ratio of number of features versus the size of the training set, the pattern matrix can be noisy and/or biased.
